title: Chinese delegation shows keen interest to develop theme park in Federal Capital
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 9 (APP): A Chinese delegation on Tuesday expressed keen interest to develop a state-of-the-art theme park in the Federal Capital to enhance beauty and infrastructure in the Federal Capital.
The delegation met with CDA chairman and Chief Commissioner Islamabad, Muhammad Ali Randhawa, to discuss various investment opportunities in the Capital city, including shifting CDA office building and streetlights across the city to solar power.
CDA chairman Randhawa welcomed the investors from brotherly countries like China.
Highlighting the importance of the proposed theme park, Randhawa emphasized its financial viability as a critical factor for the project’s success.
He appreciated China’s initiative to invest in Pakistan, underscoring the potential benefits for both nations.
Randhawa instructed that data about the conversion of CDA offices to solar power be shared with the Chinese delegation.
Additionally, he announced plans to seek professional advice from the Ministry of Energy to ensure a robust and efficient solar conversion plan.
